comment: Does the formation of phosphodiester bond actually release water? I thought it's the pyrophosphate that gets released as when dNTPs polymerize
Is your organic chemistry lecture are available
Golden teaching method. Thank you dearly Prof.
Thank you! you're a life saver.
they use Blackbords and Overhead, what year is this? 1965?
Thank you for posting this it was really helpful.

Sorry, we only have a couple of courses that have video on organic chemistry: https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/find-by-topic/#cat=science&subcat=chemistry&spec=organicchemistry (filter by video lectures). We hope this helps!

black boards are still the best in some way. specially when subject being discussed are very complex.. this way you can attack complex subject starting with very basic information, with less distraction(power point presentation - lots of graphic and information that must be stored in your brain, sometimes it easy to store and sometimes its not) .. better read books first and it will bombard you with so much of information, then you realize your information gets messy.. good thing MIT is here in Youtube. helps you organize those information in your brain and get a better understanding of what you have learned..
Great method of teaching. Focus son.
It is best method of teaching

Clearly retention is far better when words slowly unfold as written on black and white boards as their meaning is explained than snap shot whiteboard visuals with too much data to absorb without clarification in seconds....Kids may even get to spell correctly too.
